tool.name: NormalizeFasta
tool.command:
@java_options@
## Two lines below are due to the fact that picard likes fasta files to have extension .fa #import re #set escaped_element_identifier = re.sub('[^\w\-]', '_', str($inputFile.element_identifier)) ln -f -s '$inputFile' '$escaped_element_identifier'.fa && picard NormalizeFasta
INPUT='$escaped_element_identifier'.fa OUTPUT="${outFile}" LINE_LENGTH="${line_length}" TRUNCATE_SEQUENCE_NAMES_AT_WHITESPACE="${truncate_sequence_names_at_whitespaces}"
QUIET=true VERBOSITY=ERROR

param.name: inputFile
param.label: FASTA dataset or dataset collection
param.help: If empty, upload or import a FASTA dataset

param.name: line_length
param.label: The line length to be used for the output fasta file

param.name: truncate_sequence_names_at_whitespaces
param.label: Truncate sequence names at first whitespace
